entry.title: Armenian defense minister in Beijing to explore closer ties

media:group.media:title: Armenian defense minister in Beijing to explore closer ties
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenian Prime Minister Pashinyan and U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken discussed the state of normalization talks with Azerbaijan. üìç Armenian and Chinese defense ministers met in Beijing to talk about opportunities for closer military ties. üìç Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko expressed hopes for improved ties with Armenia, while strictly blaming Yerevan for the crisis in relations. üìç Insights With Eric Hacopian: Who is to blame for losing the war? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xjqgeAugjMg

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄòSky‚Äôs the limit‚Äô on Armenia‚Äôs wine renaissance
media:group.media:description:
Stepan Baghdassarian, founder and CEO of WinesofArmenia.com, sits down with CivilNet‚Äôs Mark Dovich to talk about the challenges and opportunities he has as one of the biggest importers of Armenian wines to the United States. Stepan discusses the current state of Armenian winemaking and what the future holds for the burgeoning industry.
‚ÄúArmenia is going through a wine renaissance,‚Äù Stepan says. ‚ÄúWe were the leaders of winemaking, going back at least 6,200 years, possibly more. And we‚Äôre back. Sky‚Äôs the limit.‚Äù

entry.title: Campaigners in Armenia collect signatures for EU membership referendum

media:group.media:title: Campaigners in Armenia collect signatures for EU membership referendum
media:group.media:description:
üìç Archbishop Bagrat Galstanyan confirmed plans to organize a protest in Yerevan later this month after a lengthy hiatus. In addition, Galstanyan revealed he held talks with Armenia‚Äôs former presidents, who lead the opposition to Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. üìç Pashinyan claimed his government is not obliged to give Russian border guards control of a future transit route connecting mainland Azerbaijan and Nakhichevan through Armenia. Moscow slammed what it called Pashinyan‚Äôs ‚Äúirresponsible‚Äù behavior. üìç A group of political parties launched a signature-gathering campaign in an effort to force a referendum on Armenia joining the EU. Under Armenian law, any petition that gets at least 50,000 signatures must be debated in parliament. Campaigners have 60 days.

entry.title: Who is to blame for losing the war?

media:group.media:title: Who is to blame for losing the war?
media:group.media:description:
In this week‚Äôs episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian discusses, Armenia‚Äôs development path, focusing on Yerevan‚Äôs frequent power outages. Eric also breaks down the release from prison of former Defense Minister Davit Tonoyan last month, and what to expect from parliament‚Äôs ongoing review of the 2020 Artsakh war.
